title: Back Lake (New Hampshire)
text:
Back Lake is a water body located in <a href="Coos%20County%2C%20New%20Hampshire">Coos County</a> in northern <a href="New%20Hampshire">New Hampshire</a>, United States, in the town of <a href="Pittsburg%2C%20New%20Hampshire">Pittsburg</a>. It is part of the <a href="Connecticut%20River">Connecticut River</a> <a href="drainage%20basin">watershed</a>. It is situated north of <a href="Lake%20Francis%20%28Murphy%20Dam%29">Lake Francis</a> and west of <a href="First%20Connecticut%20Lake">First Connecticut Lake</a>. <a href="U.S.%20Route%203">U.S. Route 3</a> passes by Back Lake's eastern shore.
The lake is classified as a coldwater fishery, with observed species including <a href="brook%20trout">brook trout</a>, <a href="rainbow%20trout">rainbow trout</a>, <a href="brown%20trout">brown trout</a>, and <a href="brown%20bullhead">brown bullhead</a>.
There are numerous cabins around the lake, and two public boat launch locations. Boats on the lake are generally restricted to a maximum speed of , and <a href="Personal%20watercraft">skicraft</a> have been banned since 2004.
